description: Creating policies and resources to address secondary traumatic stress in the higher education workforce.

status.text: First reading, referred to Postsecondary Education & Workforce.

original.text:
H-0021.1
HOUSE BILL 1035
State of Washington
69th Legislature
2025 Regular Session
ByRepresentatives Ortiz-Self, Reed, Timmons, Fosse, Simmons, Peterson, Pollet, Nance, and Scott
Prefiled 12/11/24.Read first time 01/13/25.Referred to Committee on Postsecondary Education & Workforce.
AN ACT Relating to policies and resources to address secondary traumatic stress in the higher education workforce; adding new sections to chapter 28B.50 RCW; and adding new sections to chapter 28B.35 RCW.
BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF WASHINGTON:
NEW SECTION.  Sec. 1. A new section is added to chapter 28B.50 RCW to read as follows:
(1) The college board shall develop or revise, and periodically update, a model policy and procedure to prevent and address secondary traumatic stress in the workforce.
(2) The model policy and procedure must include the following elements:
(a) A commitment to support mental health in the workplace;
(b) Promotion of a positive workplace climate with a focus on diversity and inclusion;
(c) Establishment of a campus-wide workforce mental health committee with the following functions:
(i) Share secondary traumatic stress, stress management, and other mental health resources and supports available through the college board, and the public employees' benefits board;
(ii) Share links to a secondary traumatic stress self-assessment tool and any associated resources; and
(iii) Report to the board of trustees and the college board at least once per year with a summary of committee activities;
(d) Regular assessment of campus-wide implementation of the policy and procedure that includes input from the workforce; and
(e) Provision of appropriate resources and training to trustees, administrators, and staff for continuous improvement.
(3) The model policy and procedure developed under this section must be posted publicly on the college board website by September 1, 2025. Updates to the model policy and procedure must be posted publicly within a reasonable time of development.
(4) By the beginning of the 2025-26 academic year, each district shall adopt, or amend if necessary, policies and procedures that, at a minimum, incorporate all the elements described in subsection (2) of this section. Districts shall periodically review their policies and procedures for consistency with updated versions of the model policy and procedure.
NEW SECTION.  Sec. 2. A new section is added to chapter 28B.50 RCW to read as follows:
The college board and each community and technical college shall publish on their websites links to resources, self-assessments, and best practices for faculty, staff, and trustees to prevent and address secondary traumatic stress in the workforce. The college board shall collaborate with the public employees' benefits board and the council of presidents to implement this section.
NEW SECTION.  Sec. 3. A new section is added to chapter 28B.35 RCW to read as follows:
(1) The regional universities shall develop or revise, and periodically update, a model policy and procedure to prevent and address secondary traumatic stress in the workforce.
(2) The model policy and procedure must include the following elements:
(a) A commitment to support mental health in the workplace;
(b) Promotion of a positive workplace climate with a focus on diversity and inclusion;
(c) Establishment of a campus-wide workforce mental health committee with the following functions:
(i) Share secondary traumatic stress, stress management, and other mental health resources and supports available through the public employees' benefits board;
(ii) Share links to a secondary traumatic stress self-assessment tool and any associated resources; and
(iii) Report to each board of trustees and regional universities at least once per year with a summary of committee activities;
(d) Regular assessment of campus-wide implementation of the policy and procedure that includes input from the workforce; and
(e) Provision of appropriate resources and training to trustees, administrators, and staff for continuous improvement.
(3) The model policy and procedure developed under this section must be posted publicly on the regional universities websites by September 1, 2025. Updates to the model policy and procedure must be posted publicly within a reasonable time of development.
(4) By the beginning of the 2025-26 academic year, each regional university shall adopt, or amend if necessary, policies and procedures that, at a minimum, incorporate all the elements described in subsection (2) of this section. Regional universities shall periodically review their policies and procedures for consistency with updated versions of the model policy and procedure.
NEW SECTION.  Sec. 4. A new section is added to chapter 28B.35 RCW to read as follows:
The regional universities shall publish on their websites links to resources, self-assessments, and best practices for faculty, staff, and trustees to prevent and address secondary traumatic stress in the workforce. The regional universities shall collaborate with the public employees' benefits board and the council of presidents to implement this section.
--- END ---

summary.text:
Purpose

The main goal of this bill is to establish policies and resources that address secondary traumatic stress within the higher education workforce in Washington State. This bill introduces requirements for the college board and regional universities to develop and update model policies aimed at supporting mental health and preventing trauma-related stress among faculty and staff. Key changes from prior legislation include a structured approach involving committees for regular assessment, workplace climate improvement, and the establishment of publicly available resources by September 1, 2025.

Key Provisions

College Board Responsibilities

  • Develop or revise a model policy and procedure to tackle secondary traumatic stress in the workforce, including:
    • Commitment to mental health support.
    • Promotion of a diverse and inclusive workplace.
    • Establish a campus-wide mental health committee to:
      • Share mental health resources and supports.
      • Provide access to a secondary traumatic stress self-assessment tool.
      • Report activities to the board of trustees annually.
    • Regularly assess policy implementation with workforce input.
    • Provide resources and training for continuous improvement.
  • Ensure the model policy is publicly available on the college board website by September 1, 2025, with timely updates.

Community and Technical Colleges

  • Publish links on their websites to resources, self-assessments, and best practices for addressing secondary traumatic stress for faculty, staff, and trustees.
  • Collaborate with the public employees' benefits board and the council of presidents in these efforts.

Regional Universities Responsibilities

  • Develop or revise a similar model policy to prevent and address secondary traumatic stress, including:
    • Same elements as required for the college board regarding mental health support, workplace climate, committee establishment, and regular assessments.
  • Post the model policy on their websites by September 1, 2025, and make updates public.

Resource Availability

  • Regional universities are also required to provide links to resources and best practices on their websites to assist in preventing and addressing secondary traumatic stress among their workforce, in collaboration with relevant boards.
